name: Yeonguk Choo
title: Software Engineer
summary: Apache Airflow Committer. Software Engineer contributing across Core UI, Backend, and testing, with speaking engagements at tech meetups and conferences.

experience.title: Committer, Apache Airflow
highlights: Contributed 50+ PRs to Core UI and Backend of a project with 15M+ monthly downloads
Reviewed 100+ community PRs across Core UI, API, E2E Test, Breeze, and i18n
Improved CI pipeline reliability by stabilizing flaky tests

experience.title: Ubuntu Member
highlights: Contributed Korean translations (i18n) via Launchpad for Ubuntu, the most widely deployed Linux distribution
Presented major release changes and installation demos at Ubuntu Release Party & InstallFest

projects.name: Kickboard Safety Module
projects.description: Computer vision system for real-time helmet detection (94% accuracy) and geofencing on edge devices
highlights: Achieved 94% detection accuracy with 15-20 FPS real-time inference on edge hardware
Optimized YOLOv5 model with TensorRT for 3x faster inference on Jetson Nano
Implemented geofencing with MQTT for low-latency location-based alerts

talks.title: Airflow + Snowflake: Building the Perfect Harmony
talks.description: Presented Airflow and Snowflake integration strategies to 3,000+ attendees at Snowflake's flagship conference in Korea

talks.title: Airflow 101 with Astro CLI
talks.description: Presented introduction to Apache Airflow development workflow using Astro CLI to 40+ attendees, covering local development setup, DAG authoring best practices, and deployment strategies
